sentence.text: He was born at term, delivered by cesarean.
During gestation a normal fetal karyotype was diagnosed.
At 36 weeks 3D ultrasonography showed telecanthus, short nose, long philtrum and short femur (Fig. 3A).
At birth, he weighed 3,660 g (50th centile), was 48.6 cm long (10th centile) and had an OFC of 34.9 cm (50th centile).
Cardiac examination, transfontanellar sonography, skeletal readiographs, and abdominal ultrasound were normal.
Mental development was shown to be normal and no behavioral problems were reported.

At present, the patient's physical examination shows short stature (107 cm; <3rd centile, −2.5 SD), OFC of 52 cm (50th centile), round face, widow's peak, synophrys, inner canthal distance of 3.4 cm (>97th centile) and outer canthal distance of 9.4 cm (>97th centile), palpebral ptosis, short nose, anteverted nares, long philtrum, bifid uvula, curved linear dimple below the lower lip, low-set ears, short neck, pectus excavatum, prominent umbilicus, brachydactyly with mild soft tissue webbing between the fingers, single crease in the fifth fingers, broad halluces (Fig. 3B,C).
